Screen.title: TopScreen
Screen.Label: ---------- Mouse Button 1 click on field to change ----------

Help.Tip: Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
Help.Text:
fxproject - PROCESSDEFAULTS
Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
 
 Default = SYSTEM
 Allowed = SYSTEM
 Allowed = PROJECT
 Allowed = USER
 SYSTEM defaults are the defaults listed in the CPS documentation.
 
 PROJECT defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as Project
 Default button.
 
 USER defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as User Default
 button.

Help.Tip: Press button to plot info.
Help.Text:
fxproject - PLOT_INFO_1
Press button to plot info.
 
 When the PLOT_INFO_1 button is pressed the info will be plotted.

Help.Tip: Press button to get files.
Help.Text:
fxproject - GET_FILES
Press button to get files.
 
 When the GET_FILE button is pressed FXPROJECT will GET the files.

Help.Tip: Press button to get files.
Help.Text:
fxproject - PUT_FILES
Press button to get files.
 
 When the PUT_FILE button is pressed FXPROJECT will PUT the files.

Help.Tip: Press button to rename files.
Help.Text:
fxproject - RENAME_FILES
Press button to rename files.
 
 When the PUT_FILE button is pressed FXPROJECT will RENAME the files.

Help.Tip: Press button to execute the selected task.
Help.Text:
fxproject - TASK_EXECUTE
Press button to execute the selected task.
 
 When the TASK_EXECUTE button is pressed
 the selected task will be executed.

Help.Tip: Select the task to execute.
Help.Text:
fxproject - TASK_SELECT
Select the task to execute.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = NONE            Do nothing.
 Allowed = RENAME_FILES    Change the file names.
 Allowed = GET_FILES       GET LIST_INFO and INFO files.
 Allowed = PUT_FILES       Put LIST_INFO and INFO files.
 Allowed = PUT_FILES_3     Put LIST_INFO, INFO and XY_SOURCE files.
 Allowed = GET_LIST_INFO   Get the list of INFO file names.
 Allowed = PUT_LIST_INFO   Put the list of INFO file names.
 Allowed = GET_INFO        Get the INFO files.
 Allowed = PUT_INFO        Put the INFO files.
 Allowed = PUT_XY_GATHER   Put the xy gather locations to an ascii file.
 Allowed = PUT_XY_BOX      Put the xy tig range locations to an ascii file.
 Allowed = COMBINE_INFO    Combine info files into a single info file.
 Allowed = SEPARATE_INFO   Separate info files into multiple info files.
 Allowed = SUBTRACT_INFO   Subtract one info from another.
 Allowed = RENAME_INFO     Change the fxinfo names.
 Allowed = PLOT_INFO       Plot info.
 Allowed = PUT_GATHER_INFO Output info for gather traces.
 IF task_select = RENAME_FILES    Change the file names.
 Set STRING_OLD to the part of the LIST_INFO, PATH_INFO and PATH_XY_SOURCE
 file names that should be altered to STING_NEW.

Help.Tip: num of cards to add during card read.
Help.Text:
fxproject - ADD_CARD_LEN
num of cards to add during card read.
 
 Default = 2000
 Allowed = int  make this larger than the num of cards in info file

Help.Tip: Change the STRING_OLD part of a character string to STRING_NEW.
Help.Text:
fxproject - STRING_OLD
Change the STRING_OLD part of a character string to STRING_NEW.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = Character
 Parameters STRING_OLD and STRING_NEW are used to change file names
 in a systmeatic fashion so the user does not have to do every thing by hand.
 When the user hits the RENAME_FILES button FXPROJECT will replace all
 occurences of character string defined by STRING_OLD with the character
 string defined by STRING_NEW in all Info file names in the array LINE_INFO
 in the Info List file name, LIST_INFO, and in the output file name,
 PATH_OUTPUT.

Help.Tip: Change the STRING_OLD part of a character string to STRING_NEW.
Help.Text:
fxproject - STRING_NEW
Change the STRING_OLD part of a character string to STRING_NEW.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = Character
 Parameters STRING_OLD and STRING_NEW are used to change file names
 in a systmeatic fashion so the user does not have to do every thing by hand.
 When the user hits the RENAME_FILES button FXPROJECT will replace all
 occurences of character string defined by STRING_OLD with the character
 string defined by STRING_NEW in all Info file names in the array LINE_INFO
 and in the Info List file name, LIST_INFO.

Help.Tip: Select the FXINFO list work file name.
Help.Text:
fxproject - SELECT_LIST_INFO
Select the FXINFO list work file name.

Help.Tip: The FXINFO list work file name.
Help.Text:
fxproject - LIST_INFO
The FXINFO list work file name.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = Character

Help.Tip: Header word indicating the X direction.
Help.Text:
fxproject - HDR_X
Header word indicating the X direction.
 
 Default = 7
 Allowed = 1<=int<=64

Help.Tip: Header word indicating the Y direction.
Help.Text:
fxproject - HDR_Y
Header word indicating the Y direction.
 
 Default = 7
 Allowed = 1<=int<=64

Help.Tip: Spurce gather flag.
Help.Text:
fxproject - SOURCE_GATHER
Spurce gather flag.
 
 Default = YES
 Allowed = YES,NO
 If SOURCE_GATHER=YES FXINFO will output info on shot gathers.
 If SOURCE_GATHER=NO  FXINFO will output info on receiver gathers.

Help.Tip: Receiver gather flag.
Help.Text:
fxproject - RECEIVER_GATHER
Receiver gather flag.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES,NO
 If RECEIVER_GATHER=NO  FXINFO will output info on shot gathers.
 If RECEIVER_GATHER=YES FXINFO will output info on receiver gathers.

Help.Text:
fxproject - INFO_ROW_NUM
Maximum num of rows to display in FXINFO tables.
 
 Default = 100
 Allowed = int
 Decreasing this number will limit how many rows of FXINFO information
 you can see, and speed up the frontend performance.

Help.Tip: Press button to plot info.
Help.Text:
fxproject - PLOT_INFO_3
Press button to plot info.
 
 When the PLOT_INFO_3 button is pressed the info will be plotted.

Help.Tip: Press button to execute the selected task.
Help.Text:
fxproject - SORT_EXECUTE
Press button to execute the selected task.
 
 When the SORT_EXECUTE button is pressed
 the selected sort will be executed.

Help.Tip: Select the sort to execute.
Help.Text:
fxproject - SORT_SELECT
Select the sort to execute.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = NONE              Do nothing.
 Allowed = CURRENT_ORDER     Sort by current order.
 Allowed = INVERSE_ORDER     Sort by inverse order.
 Allowed = RANDOM            Sort by random order.
 Allowed = FIRST_TRACE       Sort by first trace index.
 Allowed = TRACES_IN_GATHER  Sort by num of ttaces in a gather.
 Allowed = XY_SEPARATION     Sort by group x,y separation.
 Allowed = XY_POSITION       Sort by x,y position.
 Allowed = XY_POS_INFO       Sort by x,y position with list.
 Allowed = GAT_TIG_SEP       Sort by gather tig separation.
 Allowed = XY_BIN_LOC        Sort by gather bin location.
 Allowed = INDEX_2           INDEX_2 index the global sort index
 Allowed = INDEX_3           INDEX_3 index the global sort index
 Allowed = INDEX_4           INDEX_4 index the local sort index
 Allowed = INDEX_5           INDEX_5 index the local sort index
 Allowed = X_GATHER          X source position.
 Allowed = Y_GATHER          Y source position.
 Allowed = PATH_NAME         Trace file name.
 
 If SORT_SELECT = XY_POSITION
 FXPROJECT sorts info cards to obtain an optimal ordering for a partial
 shot profile migration.
 
 The order gathers in the following manner:
 
 The   sorted gather list is initialized to no points.
 The unsorted gather list is initialized to contain all gathers.
 
 The following 2 steps are iterated upon, selecting groups of SORT_GROUP_SIZE
 from the unsorted gather list to the sorted gather list.
 
 Step 1
 The gather closest to the average of the unsorted gather X,Y
 locations is selected as the next point in the sorted gather
 list for the current sort group.
 
 Step 2
 The unsorted gather list is searched for the gather that is furthest
 from any gather in the current groups sorted gather list.  This gather is
 is moved from the unsorted gather list to the sorted gather list and
 the process repeated until SORT_GROUP_SIZE gathers have been sorted.
 
 Steps 1 and 2 are repeated until all unsorted gathers have been sorted.
 
 If SORT_SELECT = XY_SEPARATION
 FXPROJECT sorts info cards to place together gathers that are within a
 distanceof XY_SEPARATION from one another. This might be used in
 conjunction with FXSORT to combine shots that are very close to
 one another.
 
 If SORT_SELECT = XY_BIN_LOC
 FXPROJECT sorts info cards according to the gather location within
 bins defined by X_TOT, X_INIT, X_LAST, X_INC and
                 Y_TOT, Y_INIT, Y_LAST, Y_INC
 The index_2 value is set to the sequential bin index with
 potential values from 1 to X_TOT*Y_TOT
 The index_3 value is set to the sequential index of gathers within bins.
 You can then sort on INDEX_3 to get all the first gathers in each bin
 sorted together followed by all the second gathers and so on.

Help.Tip: Select the sort to execute.
Help.Text:
fxproject - INFO_SORT
Select the sort to execute.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = NONE             Do nothing.
 Allowed = CURRENT_ORDER    Sort by current order.
 any of the values alloed for SORT_SELECT

Help.Tip: Press button to select subcomponents of the fxinfo file.
Help.Text:
fxproject - KEEP_EXECUTE
Press button to select subcomponents of the fxinfo file.
 
 When the KEEP_EXECUTE button is pressed
 the selected selection process will be executed.

Help.Tip: Select the keep to execute.
Help.Text:
fxproject - KEEP_SELECT
Select the keep to execute.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = NONE              Do nothing.
 Allowed = INDEX_2           INDEX_2 index the global sort index
 Allowed = INDEX_3           INDEX_3 index the global sort index
 Allowed = INDEX_4           INDEX_4 index the local sort index
 Allowed = INDEX_5           INDEX_5 index the local sort index
 Allowed = X_GATHER          X source position.
 Allowed = Y_GATHER          Y source position.
 Allowed = TRACES_IN_GATHER  num of traces in the shot.

Help.Tip: Select the info sort type.
Help.Text:
fxproject - INFO_KEEP
Select the info sort type.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = NONE              Do nothing.
 Allowed = INDEX_2           INDEX_2 index the global sort index
 Allowed = INDEX_3           INDEX_3 index the global sort index
 Allowed = INDEX_4           INDEX_4 index the local sort index
 Allowed = INDEX_5           INDEX_5 index the local sort index
 Allowed = X_GATHER          X source position.
 Allowed = Y_GATHER          Y source position.
 Allowed = TRACES_IN_GATHER  num of traces in the shot.

Help.Text:
fxproject - SORT_GROUP_SIZE
Sort group size.
 
 Default = 2000
 Allowed = integer

Help.Tip: SORT SEPARATION VALUE.
Help.Text:
fxproject - XY_SEPARATION
SORT SEPARATION VALUE.
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = real

Help.Tip: Bin gathers flag.
Help.Text:
fxproject - BIN_GATHERS
Bin gathers flag.
 
 Default = YES
 Allowed = YES,NO
 If BIN_GATHERS=YES FXINFO will bin gathers when doing xy sep sort.
 If BIN_GATHERS=NO  FXINFO will not bin gathers when doing xy sep sort.

Help.Tip: Min keep value.
Help.Text:
fxproject - KEEP_MIN
Min keep value.
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = real

Help.Tip: MAX keep value.
Help.Text:
fxproject - KEEP_MAX
MAX keep value.
 
 Default = 999999
 Allowed = real

Help.Tip: num of gathers to skip between groups.
Help.Text:
fxproject - KEEP_SKIP
num of gathers to skip between groups.
 
 Default = 999999999
 Allowed = int>=0

Help.Tip: Bin X,Y keep value.
Help.Text:
fxproject - KEEP_BIN
Bin X,Y keep value.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES,NO
 If KEEP_BIN=YES FXINFO will bin gather X,Y values during keep.
 If KEEP_BIN=NO  FXINFO will not bin gather X,Y vlaues during keep.

Help.Tip: Min info keep value.
Help.Text:
fxproject - INFO_KEEP_MIN
Min info keep value.
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = real

Help.Tip: MAX info keep value.
Help.Text:
fxproject - INFO_KEEP_MAX
MAX info keep value.
 
 Default = 999999
 Allowed = real

Help.Tip: num of gathers to skip between info groups.
Help.Text:
fxproject - INFO_KEEP_SKIP
num of gathers to skip between info groups.
 
 Default = 999999999
 Allowed = int>=0

Help.Tip: Bin X,Y keep value.
Help.Text:
fxproject - INFO_KEEP_BIN
Bin X,Y keep value.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES,NO
 If INFO_KEEP_BIN=YES FXINFO will bin gather X,Y values during keep.
 If INFO_KEEP_BIN=NO  FXINFO will not bin gather X,Y vlaues during keep.

 Allowed = int

Help.Tip: Last line for to apply task to.
Help.Text:
fxproject - LINE_LAST
Last line for to apply task to.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = int

Help.Tip: num of lines to skip between task applications.
Help.Text:
fxproject - LINE_SKIP
num of lines to skip between task applications.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = int

Help.Tip: Maximum hsot index for output.
Help.Text:
fxproject - GATHER_INDEX
Maximum hsot index for output.
 
 Default = 999999
 Allowed = int

Help.Tip: Select the auxiliary output file name.
Help.Text:
fxproject - SELECT_PATH_OUTPUT
Select the auxiliary output file name.

Help.Tip: The auxiliary output file name.
Help.Text:
fxproject - PATH_OUTPUT
The auxiliary output file name.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = Character
 This file is used for some auxiliary output
 such as a list of gather x,y locations.

Help.Tip: Button that removes this process parameter screen.
Help.Text:
fxproject - CLOSE
Button that removes this process parameter screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Appears only on the view-only process parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
Help.Text:
fxproject - OK
Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values, runs the parameter traps and removes
 the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
Help.Text:
fxproject - APPLY
Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps but does
 not remove the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
Help.Text:
fxproject - CANCEL
Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =

Help.Tip: Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
Help.Text:
fxproject - RESET
Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that sets the parameters back to their values when the screen appeared
 or to their last applied value.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
Help.Text:
fxproject - PROCESSLISTLEFT
Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the previous process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
Help.Text:
fxproject - PROCESSLIST
Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Menu that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to any chosen process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
Help.Text:
fxproject - PROCESSLISTRIGHT
Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the next process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
Help.Text:
fxproject - PROJECTDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as Project Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of Project Defaults for a project.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
Help.Text:
fxproject - USERDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as User Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of User Defaults for a userid.

Help.Tip: Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
Help.Text:
fxproject - HELP
Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 The Help Window allows access to three kinds of help:  Parameter Help, CPS
 Process Help and Application (CFE) Help.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                         C P S   P R O C E S S
 
 Name       : fxproject    ( FX PROJECT )
 Category   : Migrations
 Written    : 2002-04-18   by: Douglas Hanson
 Revised    : 2006-04-25   by: Ioan Vlad  Remove unused variables.
 Maturity   : production
 Purpose    : Monitor and manage fxshot projects.
 Portability: No known limitations.
 Parallel   : No
